intro: Taliera tali, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a striking aquatic plant native to the high-altitude lakes of South America. It features broad, heart-shaped leaves that float on the water's surface, with vibrant purple and pink flowers that bloom above the water. The plant thrives in nutrient-rich, still waters and is adapted to the cold, high-altitude climate. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Taliera tali plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing shelter for aquatic life and contributing to water purification.
